content.description:
IMAGE 1: CENTER PIVOT IRRIGATION, CIMARRON, KANSAS, UNITED STATES

IMAGE 2: IRRIGATED TERRACES, YUANYANG, YUNNAN, CHINA

Source: Esri Data Partners

Cultural practices such as land use may vary across geographical locations because of physical geography and available resources. The images illustrate two different ways humans have modified the natural landscape.
content.question:
A. Describe the map scale shown in Image 2.

B. Explain how the land use practice shown in Image 1 has altered the physical features of the landscape.

C. Explain a likely effect of terracing on soil quality.

D. Explain the degree to which mechanized irrigation may affect food insecurity in developing countries.

E. Explain how government policies may impact the incomes of commercial farmers.

frqParts.text:

unit.text: 5: Agriculture and Rural Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain a likely outcome in a geographic scenario using geographic concepts, processes, models, or theories.
